title: REQTYP
name: Requisition Type and Status
definition: Identifies the type of service being requested and the status of the request.
fieldNotes: A request may be issued as a Service Request (Inquiry) or Firm Order.  The Service Request and Firm Order process description can be found in the Access Service Ordering Overview (ATIS-0404000, Section 5, Four Step Ordering Process).
The first character of REQTYP specifies the type of service/element.
The second character of REQTYP specifies the status of the request in the four step order process.
validEntries: 1 st  Character A  = Switched Access - Feature Group A  E  = End User Special Access%2C DNAL%2C Part Time/Full Time T elevision or Program Audio%2C Specialized Ethernet Aggregation%2C Switched Ethernet Services  L  = CCS Link or Unbundled STP Port  M = T runking  ( FG B%2C C%2C D%2C SAC NXX%2C Wireless and Local ) R = Ring  S  = Special Access%2C Full Time/Part Time Television or Program Audio%2C DNAL Switched Access Facility%2C Unbundled Dedicated Transport%2C Unbundled Multiplexer%2C Specialized Ethernet Aggregation%2C Switched Ethernet Services%2C Stand Alone EVC  V  = Broadband Services%2C ATM%2C Frame Relay Service  W  = WATS Access Line  X = Broadband End User Services%2C ATM%2C Frame Rela y  Service
validEntryNotes: "E" is prohibited for Stand Alone Ethernet Virtual Connection (EVCI %3D "A") services.  VALID ENTRIES%3A  2 nd  Character (4-Step Process)  Service Request%3A   Entered  by%3A  Step 1 %E2%80%93 Service Request  A %3D Manual/mechanized  Customer  F %3D Verbal  Provider  G  %3D  Access Service Request follow up to verbal  Customer  Step 2 %E2%80%93 Service Request Confirmation  B %3D Manual/mechanized  Provider  Step 3A %E2%80%93 Firm Order %E2%80%93 Service Request Sent (Same PON)  C %3D Manual/mechanized  Customer  H %3D Verbal  Provider  J  %3D  Access Service Request follow up to verbal  Customer  Step 3B %E2%80%93 Firm Order %E2%80%93 Service Request Not Sent  D %3D Manual/mechanized  Customer  J  %3D  Access Service Request follow up to verbal  K %3D Verbal  Provider  Step 4 %E2%80%93 Firm Order Confirmation (FOC)  E %3D Manual/mechanized  Provider
usageNotes: Prohibited when the CC or WST field is populated, otherwise optional.
